title: Drawing
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. On top. In the center is the scrollwork frame of an ovoid, with the upper scrolls put through a slit in the framing lath work. Laterally at the estucheon are harpies with fish tails shown in profile. They support festoons, together with scrolls. At the lateral edges are halves of grotesque half-figures. Below. A pedestal supporting pilasters. A broader central and two lateral narrower bases are shown. In the central one is a scrollwork frame with an eagle displayed on top. The lateral ones have below a wall panel with a diamond below and a drapery above. In the zone of the capitals and arcs are niches with busts.Framing line. By the same designer as -1731.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing.Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1945.
